title: Albert Einstein
summary: Albert Einstein was a German-born theoretical physicist who is widely held to be one of the greatest and most influential scientists of all time. He is best known for developing the theory of relativity, but he also made important contributions to quantum mechanics. His work is also known for its influence on the philosophy of science.

quiz.question: In which city was Albert Einstein born?
quiz.explanation: Mentioned in the 'Early life' section - Einstein was born in Ulm, in the Kingdom of Württemberg in the German Empire.

quiz.question: What is Einstein most famous for developing?
quiz.explanation: Stated in the summary - Einstein is best known for developing the theory of relativity.

quiz.question: In which year did Einstein receive the Nobel Prize in Physics?
quiz.explanation: Mentioned in the 'Career' section - Einstein received the Nobel Prize in 1921 for his explanation of the photoelectric effect.

quiz.question: What university did Einstein attend in Switzerland?
quiz.explanation: Detailed in the 'Education' section - Einstein studied at the Swiss Federal Polytechnic (ETH Zurich).

quiz.question: What famous equation is associated with Einstein's theory of special relativity?
quiz.explanation: This mass-energy equivalence formula is one of Einstein's most famous contributions from special relativity.

quiz.question: Where did Einstein spend the last years of his life?
quiz.explanation: Mentioned in 'Later years' - Einstein lived in Princeton, working at the Institute for Advanced Study.

quiz.question: For which phenomenon did Einstein receive the Nobel Prize?
quiz.explanation: Contrary to popular belief, Einstein received his Nobel Prize for explaining the photoelectric effect, not relativity.
